title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: None Course ContentsEconomics of Agricultural Production: Theoretical Foundation-Physical Relationships-The factor-Product Relationship, The Factor-Factor Relationship, The Product-Product Relationship; Economic Relationships-The Economic Optimum; Economics of Input Substitution; Economics of Product Substitution; Agricultural Cost Relationships; Supply Behaviour; Risk attitudes in agriculture, Optimization under Risk and Uncertainty. Measurement of Technological Change, Decomposition Analysis, Farm Size and Productivity; Total Factor Productivity. Agricultural Marketing: Marketable and Marketed surplus; Market Equilibrium, Product and Input Price, Perfect and Imperfect Competitions; Market Efficiency, Cost and Price Spread, Agricultural Trade and WTO; Agriculture in India: Contribution to GDP, Plan Outlay for Agriculture, Rural Credit Structure, Multi-agency Approach to Rural Credit, Credit Supply and Gap; Subsidy, Technology, and Market.
